criteria: Observation and Data Collection: Assessing the student's ability to make relevant observations about the effect of sunlight on Earth's surfaces and collect appropriate data.
Understanding Cause and Effect: Evaluating the student's understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship between sunlight and the warming of Earth's surfaces.
Scientific Investigation Skills: Assessing the student's ability to plan and carry out an investigation to determine the effect of sunlight on Earth's surface.
descriptions: No observations are made, and no data is collected.
Limited observations are made with no relevant data collected.
Basic observations are made, but the data collected is incomplete or inaccurate.
Relevant observations are made, and some data is collected, but there are gaps in the data or inconsistencies.
Clear and relevant observations are made, and accurate data is collected, with minor inconsistencies.
Comprehensive and insightful observations are made, and accurate, detailed data is collected systematically.
No understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship is demonstrated.
A vague or inaccurate understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship is demonstrated.
A basic understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship is demonstrated, but with significant gaps.
A general understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship is demonstrated with some connections made.
A clear understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship is demonstrated with supporting evidence.
A sophisticated understanding of the cause-and-effect relationship is demonstrated with detailed explanations and examples.
No attempt to plan or carry out an investigation.
An attempt to plan an investigation is made, but it is incomplete or flawed.
A basic investigation is carried out, but it is poorly planned and executed.
A reasonably well-planned investigation is carried out, but with some weaknesses in execution.
A well-planned and executed investigation is carried out, with only minor flaws.
A skillfully planned and executed investigation is carried out, demonstrating a thorough understanding of scientific methods.
